Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp-holder with a cylindrical body with plain mouldings above and below and a band of ribbings below the upper mouldings. The conical top has a loop handle; the base is rounded and ribbed. There is a large rectangular opening surrounded by an applied cordon on three sides. Covered with a cream-coloured slip, and decorated with bands and curved lines in purple paint, fired on.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1998)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
